intro: Bossiaea disticha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bossiaea, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant produces tiny, oval-shaped fruits that contain several seeds. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open woodland and heathland habitats. Bossiaea disticha is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
